fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: The EMB refers to whatever body (or bodies) is charged with administering national elections.
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_question: Does the Election Management Body (EMB) have sufficient staff and resources to administer a well-run national election?

fxInfo_responses.value: No. There are glaring deficits in staff, financial, or other resources affecting the organization across the territory.
Not really. Deficits are not glaring but they nonetheless seriously compromised the organization of administratively well-run elections in many parts of the country.

Ambiguous. There might be serious deficiencies compromising the organization of the election but it could also be a product of human errors and co-incidence or other factors outside the control of the EMB.
Mostly. There are partial deficits in resources but these are neither serious nor widespread.
Yes. The EMB has adequate staff and other resources to administer a well-run election.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
name: v2elembcap, *_osp, *_ord
